conclusion: Problem involves shadows moving as a light source moves.

Light source initially positioned above objects, shadows change when it moves forward.
Need to determine how shadows move and change in size.
Object A looks like a piece of bread or a bun.
Object B is some kind of mechanical device or gadget.
Object C may be a feather or some textured object.
Object D is a peach.
Objects are placed on a textured ground, each casts a shadow directly below.
If light source moves forward, direction changes causing shadows to shift positions and possibly change in size.
Position and size of shadow depend on light source position and object casting shadow.
Shadow moves in direction opposite to light source's movement.
Size of shadow changes based on angle of light; closer light source might make shadow larger, farther might make it smaller.
Problem mentions light source moves forward, not closer or farther, so size changes may be due to angle change.
Moving forward could imply moving closer or farther in addition to changing direction.

Light source moves forward above objects, possibly changing height or distance.

Shadows get longer as light source moves towards horizon.
